Try to connect to a host behind a firewall (See bug 149123) for instance.
After a long timeout, connect fails and an exception is printed to stdout.

The exception should be reported to the Error Log instead.

Exceptions should be logged instead of written to stdout. Some of these should be rethrown with appropriate status so that a reason for failure is presented in the UI. I think I modified the daytime example to do this already.
With another defect I did remove a lot of the prints.   Is this something you can still reproduce?

The print to stdout does not happen any more. 

Instead, after a very long time, RSE shows a dialog:
  "Failed to connect...with an unexpected exception."
The details button shows a "java.net.ConnectException:Connection timed out" backtrace.

I think, that trying to connect a host behind a firewall is a rather frequent mis-use, and therefore I'd expect a better error message for this e.g. "Failed to connect ...: connection timed out. Check if host ... is behind a firewall. See the documentation for help."

Just noticed that in case of the connection timeout, the PDE error log is filled with a message that has the entire exception backtrace. This is about 20 lines high and looks very ugly in the PDE Error log.

causedBy.message: Connection to BUILD.ECLIPSE.ORG could not be established.
